Medical Text_eng: Fexofenadine treats allergy symptoms, including itching, sneezing, and hives. These symptoms include watery eyes, runny nose, and itchy eyes and nose. It works by blocking your body from making natural histamines when you experience an allergic reaction.

Tufnil is mainly used to relieve pain such as migraine. It is also used as a medicine for various types of headaches, including migraine pain, and fever pain. It is even recommended to take Tufnil to relieve the pain that is felt after surgery due to cuts and abrasions.

Amoxicillin is a penicillin-based antibiotic (amino-penicillin) that helps fight bacterial infections. It is one of the most commonly used antibiotics in primary care settings and is active against a wide variety of gram-positive bacteria and some gram-negative bacteria as well.

Atropine is a tropane alkaloid that is commonly used to reduce pain and inflammation. It is also effective in reducing body temperature. It works by inhibiting enzymes that cause inflammation, fever, and pain.

Azithromycin belongs to a group of drugs called macrolide antibiotics, which work by killing bacteria that cause infections. Azithromycin is intended to treat infections caused by bacteria, including but not limited to respiratory tract infections, skin and soft tissue infections, sexually transmitted diseases, and even certain types of pneumonia.
Albendazole, a potent antiparasitic drug, has attracted attention for its effectiveness in treating various worm infestations. This versatile drug can affect both intestinal and tissue parasites.

Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine medication used to treat a variety of allergic reactions, including seasonal allergies, allergic rhinitis, hives, and allergic conjunctivitis. It works by blocking the effects of histamine, a chemical that causes allergic reactions in the body. Chlorpheniramine is also effective for treating common cold symptoms such as sinus infections and sneezing.

Diclofenac is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It is intended to relieve pain and reduce inflammation by eliminating the underlying cause or factors that cause pain in the body. It can be given orally, intravenously (into a vein), rectally (through the anus), or injected subcutaneously (under the skin). It works by inhibiting prostaglandin enzymes, which are the cause of pain and inflammation.
Diclofenac can cause various allergic reactions, such as difficulty breathing, swelling of the mouth and throat, or severe skin reactions (skin pain, blisters, peeling, and skin rash).
All medicines including diclofenac should be stored at room temperature and away from direct heat and light to prevent them from spoiling. Do not store the medicine in the refrigerator.

Esomeprazole, a powerful drug, has revolutionized the treatment of gastric problems. This remarkable drug helps in treating a range of gastric diseases such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and stomach ulcers.
Take esomeprazole at the same time every day. Follow the prescription or package directions carefully. Avoid exceeding the prescribed dose or duration.

Aceclofenac belongs to the category of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). This medicine is prescribed for chronic inflammation and pain in the bones or joints. Aceclofenac works by blocking the action of an enzyme in the body known as "cyclooxygenase (COX)". This enzyme releases chemical prostaglandins at the site of injury and results in swelling, pain and inflammation. By blocking the COX enzyme, aceclofenac helps to relieve pain and reduce inflammation.

If you feel any kind of pain in your body, you must take paracetamol. This medicine can also be used to reduce the temperature if you have a fever. Do not take medicine unnecessarily. If you have some severe pain in your body that is unbearable, it is better to consult a doctor first.

Paracetamol is a pain reliever as well as an antipyretic (which reduces body temperature). It can also be taken with other medicines. Paracetamol works by inhibiting the production of inflammatory mediators such as prostaglandins, which cause pain and inflammation.

Tafinlar is mainly used to relieve pain such as migraines. Tafinlar is also used to treat various types of headaches, including migraines, fever. Tafinlar is even recommended for the treatment of post-operative pain caused by incisions.

Calcitriol is a biologically active synthetic form of vitamin D. It is used to treat conditions such as metabolic bone disease in patients with chronic kidney failure and hyperparathyroidism (overactive parathyroid glands).

Vitamin B complex plays an important role in maintaining our body's health, but since it is a water-soluble vitamin, it can be excreted from the body through urine. Excessive loss of vitamin B can lead to deficiency, especially if the person's diet is lacking in vitamin B-rich foods, for which vitamin B complex may be prescribed.
Common Medical Terms_eng: Vitamin B complex, Health, Deficiency, Food

Medical Text_eng: Vitamin B complex is mostly available in oral tablet form. Vitamin supplements should only be taken after consulting a physician and their recommended dosage should not be exceeded. B complex oral tablets can be taken after meals.
Common Medical Terms_eng: B complex, vitamins, dosage, oral tablets

Medical Text_eng: Vitamin B complex is a combination of different types of B vitamins. So, check the ingredients to see if you have any allergies to them. Also, you must consider vitamin B complex as an additional dietary supplement and in no way replaces a healthy, balanced diet. You should still eat a healthy, balanced, nutrient-dense diet.

Fexofenadine is a member of the antihistamine or anti-allergic class of drugs. It is mostly used to treat various allergies. Fexofenadine, a selective peripheral H1-blocker, can be used to treat medical conditions. The active ingredient in fexofenadine is fexofenadine, a non-drowsy antihistamine. Although some people still complain of feeling drowsy after taking it, it is used to treat allergies because it blocks the action of histamine, a chemical commonly associated with allergic reactions.

Avoid taking fexofenadine with fruit juices such as apple, orange, or grapefruit. The interaction between fexofenadine and these juices can affect the absorption and effectiveness of the medication, so it is best to take it with water or as directed by your healthcare provider.
Side effects of fexofenadine may include headache, drowsiness, dry mouth, feeling sick and dizzy, cough, fever or stomach pain, pain, difficulty hearing and ear discharge.
Common Medical Terms_eng: Side effects, headache, drowsiness, dry mouth, dizziness, cough

Medical Text_eng: In general, fexofenadine is very safe. It is unlikely that taking more than your regular dose will harm you. However, if you take too much, you may experience some common side effects. If this happens or you are concerned, you should talk to your doctor. If the patient falls, has a seizure, has difficulty breathing or cannot be woken up, contact your nearest hospital immediately.

Amoxicillin is a penicillin-based antibiotic (amino-penicillin) that helps fight bacterial infections. It is one of the most commonly used antibiotics in primary care settings and is active against a wide variety of gram-positive bacteria and some gram-negative bacteria as well.

The drug azithromycin belongs to a group of drugs called macrolide antibiotics, which work by killing bacteria that cause infections. Azithromycin is intended to treat infections caused by bacteria, including but not limited to respiratory tract infections, skin and soft tissue infections, sexually transmitted diseases, and even certain types of pneumonia.
Albendazole, a potent antiparasitic drug, has attracted attention for its effectiveness in treating a variety of worm infections. This versatile drug can affect both intestinal and tissue parasites.

Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine drug used to treat a variety of allergic reactions, including seasonal allergies, allergic rhinitis, hives, and allergic conjunctivitis. It works by blocking the effects of histamine, a chemical that causes allergic reactions in the body. Chlorpheniramine is also effective in treating common cold symptoms such as sinus infections and sneezing.

Diclofenac is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It is meant to relieve pain and reduce inflammation by eliminating the underlying causes or triggers of pain in the body. It can be given orally, intravenously (into a vein), rectally (through the anus), or injected subcutaneously (under the skin). It works by inhibiting prostaglandin enzymes, which cause pain and inflammation.
Diclofenac can cause various allergic reaction symptoms, such as difficulty breathing, swelling of the mouth and throat, or severe skin reactions (skin pain, blisters, peeling, and skin rash).
All Diclofenac medications should be stored at room temperature and away from direct heat and light to prevent spoilage. Do not store the medication in the refrigerator.

Esomeprazole, a powerful drug, has revolutionized the treatment of gastric problems. This remarkable drug helps in treating a range of gastric disorders such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and stomach ulcers.
Take esomeprazole at the same time every day. Follow the prescription or package directions carefully. Avoid exceeding the prescribed dose or duration.

Ceclo is a substituted benzimidazole-type drug, which acts as an inhibitor of gastric acid secretion. It inhibits gastric acid secretion by inhibiting the hydrogen-potassium-adenosine triphosphatase enzyme system (H+/K+ ATPase) of gastric parietal cells. After oral administration, the antacid activity of Ceclo begins within 1 hour, peaks within 2 hours and lasts up to 72 hours. When it is discontinued, acid secretion returns to normal within 3-5 days.
Omeprazole is used to control inflammation.
Aspirin is used to control pain. It primarily affects the muscles. Classified as an antibiotic, it is prescribed based on the patient's condition and medical history.
Amoxicillin is a penicillin-based antibiotic that helps fight bacterial infections.
Amoxicillin is only effective against bacterial infections and not viral diseases.
Amoxicillin is prescribed for patients with chest infections or ear infections.
Amoxicillin is not an over-the-counter medication and can only be purchased with a doctor's prescription.
Amoxicillin works by inhibiting the action of the proton pump in the stomach lining.
Amoxicillin is used to treat infections such as pharyngitis, sinusitis, and pneumonia.
Amoxicillin is available in the form of injections and oral tablets, liquids, etc.
Amoxicillin as a liquid medicine for children should be shaken well before use.
Drink plenty of fluids while taking amoxicillin.
People who are allergic to penicillin or other penicillin antibiotics should not take amoxicillin.
Side effects of amoxicillin include skin blisters, bloody nose, and headache.
Amoxicillin should be taken at the same time every day, with a minimum of 4 hours between doses.
The use of amoxicillin may cause an allergic reaction such as a rash or swelling of the face.
Disease_eng: Allergy, rash, swelling of the face

Medical Text_eng: Overdose of amoxicillin can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and seizures.
Store amoxicillin at room temperature and away from moisture and sunlight.
Amoxicillin should not be taken with blood thinners or anticoagulants.
It is safe to take amoxicillin during pregnancy, but a doctor's advice should be sought.
Do not use aceclofenac with other medications such as strontium or coumarin.

Aceclofenac belongs to the category of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). This medicine is prescribed for chronic inflammation and pain in the bones or joints. It works by blocking the effect of an enzyme in the body known as "cyclooxygenase (COX)", which reduces the release of prostaglandins and reduces swelling, pain and inflammation.
Consult your doctor before taking other medicines such as paracetamol or NSAIDs with aceclofenac.
Taking an overdose of aceclofenac can cause serious kidney or liver problems, so it is important to exercise caution.
The exact dosage and usage instructions for Aceclofenac should be obtained from your doctor.
Do not use blood thinners such as warfarin with aceclofenac, as this can cause serious side effects.
Aceclofenac is commonly used for osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis.
Aceclofenac can be effective very quickly, usually showing effects within one day to one week.
Do not use aceclofenac during pregnancy, as it may be harmful to the unborn baby.
If you miss a dose of aceclofenac, take it as soon as possible, but avoid taking it when it is time for your next dose.
If you experience vomiting or constipation while taking aceclofenac, contact your doctor.
Side effects of aceclofenac may include vomiting, diarrhea, and constipation.
Avoid taking aceclofenac on an empty stomach. Take aceclofenac with food or milk.

Atropine is a tropane alkaloid that is commonly used to reduce pain and inflammation. It is also effective in reducing body temperature. It works by inhibiting enzymes that cause inflammation, fever, and pain. Atropine is classified as an anticholinergic drug, meaning it blocks the action of acetylcholine, a neurotransmitter that plays an important role in various bodily functions.

If you miss a dose of Atropine, you can take it when you remember. However, if the next dose is due soon, you should skip the missed dose. Taking a double dose, in any case, is not recommended to make up for the missed dose.

An overdose of atropine can cause rapid heartbeat, dry mouth and skin, dilated pupils, flushed or dry skin, fever or hyperthermia, difficulty urinating or urinary retention, confusion or delirium, hallucinations, seizures, unconsciousness, and other health-related complications.
Store atropine in a cool, dry place away from heat, light, and moisture. Also, keep them out of reach of children.
Atropine can cause a variety of side effects, including dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, urinary retention, flushing, and confusion.
Atropine can be used to treat bradycardia (slow heart rate), excessive salivation or defecation, and as an antidote to certain types of poisoning and nerve agent exposure.
Atropine can be given in a variety of ways, including orally, intravenously (IV), or intramuscularly (IM), depending on the medical situation and the healthcare provider's instructions.
Side effects of atropine may include dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, and increased heart rate. These side effects are usually mild and temporary.
Azithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as pneumonia, bronchitis, skin infections, ear infections, etc.
Disease_eng: Pneumonia, bronchitis, skin infections, ear infections

Medical Text_eng: Azithromycin is available in the form of tablets, capsules, and liquid suspension. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Typically, adults are prescribed 250 to 500 mg tablets every 24 hours.
Some common side effects of azithromycin are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, and headache.

Azithromycin dihydrate is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by susceptible organisms such as respiratory tract infections including bronchitis and pneumonia, skin and soft tissue infections, upper respiratory tract infections including otitis media, sinusitis, pharyngitis and tonsillitis. It is also indicated for uncomplicated genital infections caused by Chlamydia trachomatis and typhoid fever.
Disease_eng: Bronchitis, pneumonia, typhoid fever, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis

Medical Text_eng: Azithromycin is an azalide antibiotic that is effective against gram-positive and gram-negative microorganisms.
If you miss a dose of azithromycin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking an overdose of azithromycin can cause serious side effects such as liver damage, irregular heartbeat, and hearing loss.
Store azithromycin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture. Keep out of the reach of children.

Azithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic that works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. It is effective against a wide range of bacteria, including gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, and some other microorganisms. It is used to treat respiratory infections, skin infections, sexually transmitted diseases, and other infections.
Disease_eng: Respiratory infections, skin infections, sexually transmitted diseases

Medical Text_eng: Loratadine is an antihistamine used to reduce allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose.
Loratadine is available in tablet, capsule, and syrup forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the allergy.
Some common side effects of loratadine are headache, drowsiness, dry mouth, and fatigue.
Sedating antihistamines make you less likely to fall asleep than older people.
If you miss a dose of loratadine, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Loratadine overdose can cause serious side effects such as blurred vision, confusion, hallucinations, and seizures.
Store loratadine in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Loratadine is an antihistamine that works by blocking the action of histamine in the body. Histamine is a chemical that causes allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose. Loratadine helps reduce these symptoms.
Cetirizine is an antihistamine used to reduce allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose.
Cetirizine is available in tablet, capsule and syrup form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the allergy.
Some common side effects of cetirizine are drowsiness, dry mouth, sneezing or blocked and runny nose.
Cetirizine may interact with certain substances, increasing the chance of possible side effects or changing its effectiveness.
If you miss a dose of Cetirizine, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking too much cetirizine can cause serious side effects such as blurred vision, confusion, hallucinations, and seizures.
Store Cetirizine in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Cetirizine is an antihistamine that works by blocking the action of histamine in the body. Histamine is a chemical that causes allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose. Cetirizine helps reduce these symptoms.
Doxycycline is a tetracycline class antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as acne, urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, sexually transmitted diseases, etc.
Disease_eng: Acne, urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, sexually transmitted diseases

Medical Text_eng: Doxycycline is available in tablet, capsule and liquid suspension form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Usually, adults are prescribed 100 mg tablets every 12 hours.
Some common side effects of doxycycline are nausea, diarrhea, hoarseness, back pain, pale skin, vomiting, itching, dry mouth, anxiety, loss of appetite.
Tetracycline is another medication that can be taken in place of doxycycline.
If you miss a dose of doxycycline, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking an overdose of doxycycline can cause serious side effects such as headache, joint pain, chest pain, shortness of breath, unusual bleeding,
Store doxycycline in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Doxycycline is a tetracycline class antibiotic that works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. It is effective against a wide range of bacteria, including gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, and some other microorganisms.
Lansoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that is used to treat GERD and ulcers by reducing acid production in the stomach.
Lansoprazole is available in capsule, tablet and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of lansoprazole are diarrhea, stomach pain, nausea, constipation.
If you miss a dose of lansoprazole, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Taking too much lansoprazole can cause serious side effects such as kidney problems and overgrowth of Clostridium difficile (C. diff) in the intestines. Symptoms may include watery diarrhea that doesn't go away, severe stomach pain, fever, or blood in the stool.

The key to lansoprazole's effectiveness lies in its ability to target the H+, K+-ATPase enzyme, a key enzyme in the final step of acid secretion in the parietal cells. By inhibiting this enzyme, lansoprazole effectively reduces the acid produced in the stomach.
Store lansoprazole in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Lansoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces acid production by blocking the action of the proton pump in the parietal cells of the stomach. It is used to treat GERD, peptic ulcers, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and other acid-related conditions.
Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine class medication used to treat anxiety and panic disorders.
Alprazolam is available in tablet and oral solution form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Alprazolam abuse can lead to overdose, addiction, or other serious conditions. Therefore, only the person for whom it was prescribed should take the medication.

Some common side effects of alprazolam are shallow breathing, a seizure, double vision, dizziness, risk-taking behavior, hallucinations, decreased need for sleep, increased energy, feeling excited or overly talkative, rapid thinking, drowsiness.
If you miss a dose of Alprazolam, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Some symptoms of alprazolam overdose to watch out for include: shallow breathing, fainting, confusion, slow heartbeat, extreme drowsiness, dizziness.
Store alprazolam in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine class drug that acts on gamma-aminobutyric acid receptors in the brain to reduce the excitability of nerve cells. It is used to treat anxiety, panic disorder, and other anxiety-related conditions.
Atorvastatin is a statin class of medication used to lower cholesterol and triglyceride levels in the blood.
Atorvastatin is available in tablet form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood cholesterol levels.
Some common side effects of atorvastatin are pain, diarrhea, heartburn, nausea, and muscle pain.
If you miss a dose of Atorvastatin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Serious side effects of atorvastatin include rhabdomyolysis, liver problems
Store atorvastatin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Atorvastatin is a statin drug that works by reducing cholesterol production in the liver. It helps reduce the risk of heart disease by lowering LDL cholesterol ("bad" cholesterol) and increasing HDL cholesterol ("good" cholesterol).
Labetalol is a beta blocker used to control high blood pressure. It works on the heart rate and blood vessels to lower blood pressure.
Labetalol is available in tablet form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of labetalol are nausea, stomach upset, headache, heartburn, indigestion, dizziness, bad taste in the mouth, weakness.
If you miss a dose of labetalol, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Store labetalol in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Labetalol is a beta blocker that acts on beta-adrenergic receptors in the heart and blood vessels. It reduces the effects of the hormones epinephrine and norepinephrine, lowering heart rate and blood pressure. It is used to treat high blood pressure, irregular heartbeat, and headaches.
Disease_eng: High blood pressure, irregular heartbeat, headache

Medical Text_eng: Metformin is a biguanide class of medication used to control type 2 diabetes. It lowers blood sugar levels by reducing glucose production in the liver, reducing glucose absorption from the intestines, and increasing glucose utilization in cells.
Metformin is available in tablet form. It is usually taken once or twice a day with food. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood sugar level.
Metformin is used to treat type 2 diabetes. It works by restoring your body's response to insulin. It also reduces the amount of sugar your liver makes, which your stomach or intestines absorb.

Some common side effects of metformin are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, upset stomach, fever and chills, painful urination, nervousness, weakness, metallic taste, a general feeling of discomfort, shortness of breath, muscle pain and cramps, loss of appetite, cool pale skin, anxiety, confusion, cold sweats, headache, increased sweating, difficulty speaking, tremors.
If you miss a dose of metformin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
If you experience shallow breathing, chills, slow heartbeat, and yellowing of the eyes after taking an overdose of metformin, you must consult a doctor.
Keep metformin tablets away from heat, direct sunlight, moisture, and cold temperatures. Store them in a closed container at room temperature, out of the reach of children.
Metformin is a long-term medication. Thus, some people have to take the medication forever. Moreover, the results depend on the severity of the condition.

Metformin is a biguanide class drug used to control type 2 diabetes. It lowers blood sugar levels by increasing the effectiveness of the hormone insulin aspart and reducing glucose production in the liver.
Metformin starts working within a week of treatment. However, it does not dramatically lower your blood sugar levels. Depending on your dosage, it takes about 5-6 days to see results.
Insulin is a hormone that controls blood sugar levels. It is used to control type 1 diabetes and in some cases type 2 diabetes.
Insulin aspart is available as an injection. It is given under the skin or into a vein. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood sugar level.
Some common side effects of insulin are hypoglycemia, lipodystrophy, weight gain, peripheral edema.
You should take insulin injections as advised by a registered doctor.

Store insulin aspart in a refrigerator at 2°C to 8°C. Do not freeze. Insulin for immediate use does not need to be refrigerated, try to keep it in a cool place and away from heat and light. Used insulin can be kept at room temperature for one month.

Insulin is a hormone secreted by the pancreas. It helps glucose enter cells and controls blood sugar levels. In type 1 diabetes, the pancreas cannot produce enough insulin, so patients have to take insulin aspart injections.
Glimepiride is a sulfonylurea class drug used to control type 2 diabetes. It lowers blood sugar levels by increasing the release of insulin aspart from the pancreas.
A doctor's prescription is always required to purchase glimepiride.
Glimepiride is available in tablet form. It is usually taken once a day. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood sugar level.
Glimepiride lowers blood sugar levels by stimulating the pancreas to produce insulin aspart, which is needed to break down sugar in the body and lower blood sugar levels.
Some common side effects of glimepiride are headache, low blood sugar, nausea, weight gain, and low blood sugar levels (hypoglycemia).
If you miss a dose of glimepiride, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Serious side effects of glimepiride include hypoglycemia (too low blood sugar), hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions, dark urine, yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes, pale or tarry stools, and low sodium levels.
Store glimepiride in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Glimepiride is a sulfonylurea drug that acts on the beta cells of the pancreas to increase insulin aspart secretion. It is used to control type 2 diabetes, especially when lifestyle changes and other medications are not effective in controlling blood sugar levels.
Within 2 to 3 hours, a single dose of glimepiride lowers blood sugar levels.
Metoprolol is a beta blocker used to control high blood pressure, heart failure, and irregular heartbeat.
Disease_eng: High blood pressure, heart failure, irregular heartbeat

Medical Text_eng: Metoprolol is available in tablet and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of metoprolol are headache, rash, fatigue, cold hands and feet, nausea, and depression.

Metoprolol works by blocking the action of certain hormones, such as adrenaline, which affect the heart and blood vessels. By doing this, it reduces the heart rate and the force with which the heart pumps blood. This results in lower blood pressure and less strain on the heart.
If you miss a dose of metoprolol, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Store metoprolol in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Metoprolol usually starts working within two hours and reaches its full effect after about a week. It is normal not to feel any immediate changes in your body, but this does not indicate that the medication is not effective.

Metoprolol is a beta blocker that acts on beta-adrenergic receptors in the heart and blood vessels. It reduces the heart rate and blood pressure by reducing the effects of the hormones epinephrine and norepinephrine. It is used to prevent high blood pressure, heart failure, irregular heartbeat, and headaches.
Disease_eng: High blood pressure, heart failure, irregular heartbeat, headache

Medical Text_eng: Enalapril is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
Enalapril is available in tablet form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of enalapril are dizziness, weakness, skin rash, cough.
If you miss a dose of Enalapril, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

If you experience signs of infection while taking enalapril, such as persistent sore throat, cough, fever, chills, night sweats, difficulty breathing, painful or frequent urination, irregular vaginal discharge, or white patches on your face, contact your doctor immediately.
Store enalapril in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture. Keep out of the reach of children.
If you overdose on enalapril, seek immediate medical attention as this may be a medical emergency.
Erlotinib, a revolutionary drug in the field of oncology, serves as a beacon of hope for those battling certain types of cancer. This drug is known for its targeted approach to cancer treatment.
Erlotinib is a targeted therapy drug that falls under the category of tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs).

Erlotinib is specifically designed to fight cancer by blocking the pathways that tumor cells use to grow, divide, and spread. Unlike chemotherapy, which affects all rapidly dividing cells, erlotinib offers a more focused approach, targeting only cancer cells and sparing as many normal, healthy cells as possible from damage.
Take Erlotinib as directed by a registered physician.
Store erlotinib in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Allopratinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor that works by blocking the action of certain proteins involved in the growth and spread of cancer cells. It is mainly used to treat advanced renal cell carcinoma (RCC) and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), where other treatments have not been effective.
Salbutamol is a selective beta-2 adrenoreceptor agonist.
Salbutamol is a respiratory medicine used to treat asthma and other respiratory diseases. It relaxes the smooth muscles in the airways, making it easier to breathe.
Salbutamol is available in inhaler, tablet and syrup forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of salbutamol are tremors, nervousness, headache, sudden noticeable heart rate (palpitations), trembling, especially in the hands, muscle cramps.
If you miss a dose of Salbutamol, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Salbutamol is a medication that has a significant impact on the management of respiratory conditions such as asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). This bronchodilator works by relaxing the smooth muscles in the airways, making it easier for people with respiratory problems to breathe.

Serious side effects of salbutamol may include: irregular heartbeat (cardiac arrhythmia), low potassium blood levels (hypokalemia), increased blood flow to the extremities (peripheral vasodilation), increased blood flow to the extremities (peripheral vasodilation)
Store salbutamol in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Salbutamol is a beta2-adrenergic agonist that acts on beta2-adrenergic receptors in the airways to relax smooth muscle. It helps to ease breathing in cases of asthma, COPD and other respiratory diseases.
Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that is used to treat GERD and ulcers by reducing acid production in the stomach.
Pantoprazole is available in tablet and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the severity of the disease.
No significant drug interactions were found with pantoprazole in clinical studies.
Some common side effects of pantoprazole are headache and diarrhea.
Be careful not to break, chew, or crush pantoprazole tablets.
If you miss a dose of Pantoprazole, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Rare side effects of pantoprazole include abdominal pain, flatulence, rash, insomnia, and hyperglycemia.
Long-term use of pantoprazole may result in inadequate absorption of cyanocobalamin (vitamin B12) or increase the risk of osteoporosis-related problems.
Keep pantoprazole in a dry place, away from light and heat. Keep out of the reach of children.

Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces acid production by blocking the action of the proton pump in the parietal cells of the stomach. It is used to treat GERD, peptic ulcers, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and other acid-related conditions.
Famotidine is a histamine-2 receptor blocker that is used to treat GERD and ulcers by reducing acid production in the stomach.
Famotidine is also indicated in the treatment of acute gastritis, chronic gastritis in the acute stage of exacerbation.
Famotidine is available in tablet, capsule and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight and severity of the disease.
Famotidine interactions with other drugs: No data available.
Some common side effects of famotidine are constipation, diarrhea, dry mouth, nausea, dizziness, lightheadedness, tachycardia, high blood pressure, headache, and loss of appetite.
The use of famotidine can be reduced depending on the condition of the patient. It should be used with caution in the elderly, patients with urinary and hepatic disorders.
If you miss a dose of famotidine, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
There is no information available on serious side effects of famotidine.
Store Famotidine below 30°C, away from light and moisture. Keep out of reach of children.

Famotidine is a histamine-2 receptor blocker that reduces acid production by blocking the action of histamine on the parietal cells of the stomach. It is used to treat GERD, peptic ulcers, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and other acid-related conditions.
Benadryl (diphenhydramine) is an antihistamine used to reduce allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose.
Benadryl is available in tablet, capsule, and liquid forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the allergy.
Some common side effects of Benadryl are drowsiness, headache, dry mouth, and constipation.
If you miss a dose of Benadryl, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Store Benadryl in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine) is an antihistamine that works by blocking the action of histamine in the body. Histamine is a chemical that causes allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose. Benadryl helps reduce these symptoms.
Ciprofloxacin is a quinolone class antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, etc.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea

Medical Text_eng: Ciprofloxacin is indicated for the treatment of single infections and mixed infections caused by two or more susceptible organisms.

Ciprofloxacin is available in tablet, capsule, injection and oral suspension forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Generally, adults are prescribed 250 to 750 mg tablets every 12 hours.
Take Cyprosin medicine as advised by a registered doctor.

Ciprofloxacin is rapidly and well absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract after oral administration and is widely distributed in the body systems and body fluids. Its half-life is 3.5 hours. After oral administration, 30%-50% of ciprofloxacin is excreted in the urine as unchanged drug and as active metabolites within 24 hours.
Magnesium/aluminum antacids, sucralfate, or any medication containing calcium, iron, or zinc should not be taken with Ciprosin.
Some common side effects of Cyprosin are nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, digestive upset, and lower abdominal pain.
If you miss a dose of Cyprosin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Ciprofloxacin should be administered with caution to patients with neurological disorders such as arteriosclerosis or epilepsy or those prone to seizures and convulsions.
Store Cyprosin away from light and moisture, below 30°C. Keep out of the reach of children.

Ciprofloxacin is a quinolone antibiotic that interferes with the DNA replication process of bacteria, preventing them from growing and multiplying. It is used to treat urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, prostatitis, and other bacterial infections.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, prostatitis

Medical Text_eng: Cyprosin can be taken before or after meals, with plenty of fluids.
Milk and dairy products should not be taken with Cyprosin because they greatly reduce the absorption of Cyprosin. Calcium in food does not affect the absorption of Cyprosin.
Although effective in clinical trials, cyprosin is not considered a first-line drug in the pediatric population.
Overdose of Cyprosin can cause convulsions, hallucinations, abdominal discomfort, kidney and liver dysfunction, as well as crystalluria, hematuria, and reversible kidney toxicity.
Disease_eng: Convulsions, hallucinations, abdominal discomfort, kidney and liver dysfunction

Medical Text_eng: Naproxen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, inflammation, and fever.

Naproxen primarily inhibits both COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes. COX enzymes are responsible for the production of prostaglandins, which are hormone-like substances involved in inflammation, pain signaling, and fever responses.
Naproxen is available in tablet, capsule, and liquid suspension forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of naproxen are nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, headache, dizziness, and drowsiness.
If you miss a dose of naproxen, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Naproxen minor side effects: shortness of breath, difficulty speaking, chest pain, weakness on one side or in a specific part of the body, asthma attacks in people with asthma, high blood pressure.
Disease_eng: Shortness of breath, chest pain, high blood pressure, swelling of the face or throat

Medical Text_eng: Keep room temperature between 20 and 25 degrees Celsius (68 and 77 degrees Fahrenheit). Store naproxen in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Naproxen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces pain and inflammation by reducing the production of a chemical called prostaglandin. It is used to treat headaches, toothaches, muscle pain, menstrual cramps, arthritis, and other inflammatory conditions.
Disease_eng: Headache, toothache, muscle pain, menstrual pain, arthritis

Medical Text_eng: After taking naproxen, you should feel better within about an hour. If you take naproxen twice a day as directed, it may take up to 3 days for it to start working effectively.
Furosemide is a loop diuretic that removes excess fluid and salt from the body. It is used to reduce edema caused by high blood pressure, heart failure, liver and kidney disease.
Disease_eng: High blood pressure, heart disease, liver and kidney disease

Medical Text_eng: Furosemide has a unique role in renal tubular function. It is capable of producing the highest diuresis than other diuretics.
Furosemide is available in tablet and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
The use of furosemide with antibiotics that are toxic to the nephron may increase the adverse effects of the antibiotics.
Prolonged use of furosemide with other diuretics may cause electrolyte and water imbalance.
If you miss a dose of furosemide, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Use of furosemide by breastfeeding mothers may result in cessation of lactation or furosemide may be excreted in breast milk. In such cases, it should be used with caution.
Excessive use of furosemide can cause alkalosis. Furosemide can increase blood glucose levels and increase glucose levels in the urine.
Keep furosemide away from light. Do not use after the expiration date. Keep all medicines out of the reach of children.
Furosemide is only available on prescription from a registered physician.
Tenofovir is an antiviral medication used to treat HIV and hepatitis B infections.
The drug tenofovir belongs to a class of drugs called nucleotide analogue reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).
Tenofovir is available in tablet and oral solution form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.

Some common side effects of tenofovir are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, headache, rash or itching, depression, difficulty falling or staying asleep, weight loss, gas, heartburn, or indigestion, back pain.
If you miss a dose of tenofovir, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking too much tenofovir can cause serious side effects such as kidney problems, liver problems, lactic acidosis, and decreased bone density.
Store tenofovir in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Tenofovir is a nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI) that works by preventing the reproduction of HIV and hepatitis B viruses. It attaches to the DNA of the viruses and disrupts their replication process.
Gentamicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, meningitis, etc.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, meningitis

Medical Text_eng: Gentamicin is available in the form of injections, creams, and ointments. The dosage and method of application depend on the type and severity of the infection.
Gentamicin belongs to a group of drugs called aminoglycoside antibiotics.
Gentamicin helps treat a range of bacterial infections.
Some common side effects of gentamicin are feeling irritable, loss of appetite, upset stomach, and imbalance.
If your doctor prescribes the use of gentamicin, follow his instructions carefully.
Store gentamicin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Gentamicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic that works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. It is primarily used to treat infections caused by Gram-negative bacteria, but is also effective against some Gram-positive bacteria.
Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, inflammation, and fever.
Ibuprofen has high anti-inflammatory, antipyretic, and analgesic efficacy.
Ibuprofen is a potent inhibitor of the cyclooxygenase enzyme, so it significantly reduces the synthesis of prostaglandins.

Ibuprofen inhibits the synthesis of compounds produced by lipoxygenase. Therefore, ibuprofen quickly relieves pain and stiffness, reduces swelling, and improves the mobility of various joints in arthritis patients.
The dosage and method of administration of ibuprofen depend on the patient's age and the severity of the disease.

Ibuprofen is indicated for the following symptoms: rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, gouty arthritis, juvenile polyarthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, synovitis, back pain, dysmenorrhea, fever, migraine, soft tissue injuries, and inflammation and pain of teeth and muscles.
Disease_eng: Rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, gouty arthritis, juvenile polyarthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, synovitis, back pain, dysmenorrhea, fever, migraine, soft tissue injuries and inflammation and pain of teeth and muscles

Medical Text_eng: Some common side effects of ibuprofen include stomach upset, vomiting, heartburn, and nausea.
If you miss a dose of ibuprofen, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

The possibility of adverse effects on the developing fetus cannot be completely ruled out. Ibuprofen should not be given during pregnancy and breastfeeding unless the benefits to the mother outweigh the risks.
Keep all ibuprofen medicines out of the reach of children. Store in a cool, clean place, away from light.

Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces pain and inflammation by reducing the production of a chemical called prostaglandin. It is used to relieve headaches, toothaches, muscle aches, menstrual cramps, and arthritis pain.
Disease_eng: Headache, toothache, muscle pain, menstrual pain, arthritis

Medical Text_eng: Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine used to reduce allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose.
Chlorpheniramine maleate is an alkyl amine antihistamine.
Chlorpheniramine is available in tablet, capsule, and syrup forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age and the severity of the allergy.
Chlorpheniramine may interact with other drugs such as calcium chloride, kanamycin sulfate, noradrenaline acid tartrate, pentobarbital sodium, and meglumine adipiodan.
Some common side effects of chlorpheniramine are drowsiness, muscle weakness, and digestive problems.
If you miss a dose of chlorpheniramine, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
The use of chlorpheniramine should be avoided during pregnancy and breastfeeding, especially in the first trimester.
It should not be used in people who are hypersensitive to chlorpheniramine and in newborns.

Overdose of chlorpheniramine may cause CNS depression, insomnia, hallucinations, tremors, convulsions, ringing in the ears, blurred vision, hypotension, agitation, and atropine-like symptoms (dry mouth and tongue, dilated pupils, feeling excessively hot), etc.
Store chlorpheniramine in a cool (below 25°C) and dry place away from light. Keep out of the reach of children.

Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that works by blocking the action of histamine in the body. Histamine is a chemical that causes allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, and runny nose. Chlorpheniramine helps reduce these symptoms.

Chlorpheniramine should be used with caution in patients with glaucoma and prostatic hypertrophy. Caution should be exercised when driving or operating machinery during treatment with chlorpheniramine.
Gabapentin is an anticonvulsant medication used to treat epilepsy and nerve pain.
Gabapentin is available in tablet, capsule, and oral solution forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.

Gabapentin belongs to a class of drugs called anticonvulsants. It was first approved for use in the United States in 1993 and has since become a widely prescribed medication for a variety of conditions.
Some common side effects of gabapentin are drowsiness, flushing, difficulty walking, dizziness.
If you miss a dose of Gabapentin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Overdosing on gabapentin can cause serious side effects such as restlessness, worsening depression, uncontrolled back-and-forth or rolling eye movements, allergic reactions, signs and symptoms of toxicity, such as yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes, vomiting, dark urine, light-colored stools, and unusual bleeding or bruising.
Gabapentin has a significant impact in the management of various neurological conditions, from epilepsy to neuropathic pain.
Store gabapentin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Gabapentin is an anticonvulsant medication that works on the brain chemicals that cause seizures. It is also effective in reducing nerve pain, especially postherpetic neuralgia (nerve pain caused by shingles).
Diclofenac is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, inflammation, and fever.
The dosage and method of administration of diclofenac depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of diclofenac are sweating, itching, constipation, drowsiness, swelling of the feet and hands, nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, headache, high blood pressure.
If you miss a dose of Diclofenac, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Diclofenac capsules or tablets take 20 to 30 minutes to work. Suppositories take a few hours to show results.
Taking an overdose of diclofenac can cause serious side effects and poisoning.

Diclofenac All medicines should be stored at room temperature and away from direct heat and light to prevent them from spoiling. Do not store medicines in the refrigerator. Never throw these medicines into the drainage system or flush them down the washroom.

Diclofenac is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces pain and inflammation by reducing the production of a chemical called prostaglandin. It is used to relieve headaches, toothaches, muscle pain, menstrual cramps, and arthritis pain.
Disease_eng: Headache, toothache, muscle pain, menstrual pain, arthritis

Medical Text_eng: Diclofenac is one of the most popular medications for relieving arthritis pain. Diclofenac is safe and effective in limited doses.
Clozapine is an atypical antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia and other mental disorders.

Clozapine is a new class of antipsychotic medication. It differs from other antipsychotics in that it binds to dopamine-sensitive receptors and has different effects on various dopamine-mediated functions.
Clozapine is available in tablet form. It is usually taken once or twice a day. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Take clozapine medicine as per the advice of a registered doctor.
Some common side effects of clozapine are constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, headache, drooling, nausea, unusual weight gain, abdominal discomfort or heartburn, and dry mouth.
Clozapine medication should not be stopped suddenly. It should be stopped gradually over 1-2 weeks.
If you miss a dose of clozapine, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Clozapine overdose can also cause dizziness, delirium, and coma, tachycardia, hypotension, respiratory depression or failure, hypersalivation, aspiration pneumonia, and cardiac arrhythmias. Overdose is considered to be an overdose if taken in excess of 2500 grams.
Clozapine should not be stored above 30°C. Keep away from light and out of the reach of children.

Clozapine is an atypical antipsychotic medication that acts on dopamine and serotonin receptors in the brain. It is effective in treating both positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia. It produces fewer extrapyramidal side effects (EPS) than other antipsychotic medications.
Lantus (insulin aspartglargine) is a long-acting insulin aspart analog used to control type 1 and type 2 diabetes. It works by lowering blood sugar levels.
Lantus is available as an injection. It is usually injected under the skin once a day. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood sugar level.
Some common side effects of Lantus are pain, redness, or swelling at the injection site, weight gain, and low blood sugar levels (hypoglycemia).
If you miss a dose of Lantus, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking an overdose of Lantus can cause serious side effects such as hypoglycemia (too low blood sugar levels) and allergic reactions.
Store Lantus in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture. Read the package leaflet before use.

Lantus is a long-acting insulin aspart analog used to control type 1 and type 2 diabetes. It works by controlling blood sugar levels over a 24-hour period. It mimics the release of insulin aspart from the pancreas and helps cells take up glucose.

Metformin is indicated for the treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus, especially in patients who are overweight and whose blood glucose levels are not adequately controlled by diet and exercise alone.

Metformin hydrochloride is a biguanide class drug used to control type 2 diabetes. It lowers blood sugar levels by reducing glucose production in the liver, reducing glucose absorption from the intestines, and increasing glucose utilization in cells.

Metformin hydrochloride is available in tablet form. It is usually taken once or twice a day with food. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and blood sugar levels.
Take metformin hydrochloride medicine as per the advice of a registered doctor.
Some common side effects of metformin hydrochloride are nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhea, and loss of appetite.
If you miss a dose of metformin hydrochloride, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking too much metformin hydrochloride can cause serious side effects such as lactic acidosis (accumulation of lactic acid in the blood).
Store metformin hydrochloride in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Metformin hydrochloride is a biguanide class drug used to control type 2 diabetes. It lowers blood sugar levels by increasing the effectiveness of the hormone insulin and decreasing glucose production in the liver.
Coralcal-DX is used for the prevention and treatment of osteoporosis, osteomalacia, tetany, hypoparathyroidism, and osteogenesis imperfecta.
CoralCal-DX Tablets contain: Calcium Carbonate USP 1500 mg (from coral source) 600 mg Elemental Calcium and Vitamin D USP 400 IU.
Coralcal-DX is taken as one tablet 1-2 times a day with plenty of water or as directed by a physician. Absorption is better when taken on a full stomach.
Hypersensitivity to Coralcal-DX, hypocalcemia due to vitamin D overdose, hyperparathyroidism, bone metastasis, severe urinary retention, severe hypercalciuria, renal calculi, etc.
Side effects of Coralcal-DX may include flatulence, heartburn, diarrhea, or constipation in rare cases. Long-term use may result in hypercalcemia.
Disease_eng: Hypercalcemia, flatulence, heartburn, diarrhea or constipation

Medical Text_eng: Store Coralcal-DX below 30°C. Keep away from light and moisture. Keep out of reach of children.
Calcium tablets are used to replenish calcium deficiency in the body. Calcium is important for healthy bones and teeth.
Calcium tablets are available in different strengths. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of calcium deficiency.
Some common side effects of calcium tablets are nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, and constipation.
If you miss a dose of calcium tablets, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Store calcium tablets in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Calcium tablets are used to replenish calcium deficiency in the body. Calcium is important for the health of bones and teeth, and also plays an important role in muscle contraction, nerve transmission, and blood clotting.

Vitamin B complex is a nutritional supplement that helps to replenish B vitamins in the body. It is a mixture of various B vitamins, such as -- thiamine (B1), riboflavin (B2), niacin (B3), pantothenic acid (B5), pyridoxine (B6), biotin (B7), folate (B9) and cobalamin (B12).
Vitamin B complex is available in tablet, capsule and injection form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight and severity of the B vitamin deficiency.

Some common side effects of vitamin B complex are nausea, skin conditions such as flushing or bruising, high blood sugar levels, sensitivity to light due to nerve damage and blurred vision, increased urination, excessive thirst, diarrhea, and stomach pain are examples.
If you miss a dose of Vitamin B Complex, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking too much vitamin B complex can cause serious side effects, such as liver damage.
Always consult a doctor for the correct dosage prescription of Vitamin B Complex.
Store vitamin B complex in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Vitamin B complex is used to replenish B vitamins in the body. B vitamins play an important role in various functions of the body, such as -- energy production, blood cell production, nervous system health, DNA synthesis, and cell division.
Zinc tablets are used to replenish zinc deficiency in the body. Zinc is important for boosting immunity, healing wounds, and physical growth and development.
Zinc tablets are available in different strengths. The dosage and method of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of zinc deficiency.
Zinc tablets are most effective when taken 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals. It can be taken with food if you have digestive problems.
Take zinc tablets as prescribed by a registered physician.
Some common side effects of zinc tablets include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, digestive problems, heartburn, and stomach inflammation.

Taking tetracycline and zinc together may reduce the absorption of both. Similarly, taking zinc and quinolone drugs together may reduce the absorption of both. Taking penicillamine and zinc together may reduce the absorption of zinc.
If you miss a dose of Zinc Tablet, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking excessive doses of zinc tablets can cause zinc accumulation in the body in cases of acute renal failure; in that case, the dosage may need to be adjusted.
Store zinc tablets in a dry place away from light and heat. Keep out of the reach of children.

Zinc tablets are used to replenish zinc deficiency in the body. Zinc is an essential mineral that plays an important role in various functions of the body, such as -- boosting immunity, wound healing, physical growth and development, DNA synthesis, and cell division.
Artemether is an antimalarial drug used to treat malaria. It is a derivative of artemisinin.

Artemether is available in tablet form. It is usually given in combination with other antimalarial drugs. The dosage and route of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Artemether is not indicated in the first 3 months of pregnancy.
Artemether and lumefantrine are well tolerated and side effects are generally mild to moderate.
Artemether should not be used in breastfeeding mothers. Breastfeeding should only be done within 28 days of taking the medicine if the benefits outweigh the risks.
Take artemether medicine as advised by a registered doctor.
If you miss a dose of Artemether, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Artemether and lumefantrine are indicated for the treatment of malaria on an emergency basis in cases of Plasmodium falciparum malaria or various types of mixed malaria where Plasmodium falciparum is also responsible.
Store Artemether away from light and moisture, below 30 degrees C. Keep out of the reach of children.

Artemether is an antimalarial drug that works by inhibiting the growth of the malaria parasite. It is particularly effective in treating Plasmodium falciparum malaria, a severe form of malaria. It is usually given in combination with other antimalarial drugs to increase the effectiveness of the treatment and reduce the risk of developing resistance.
Ciprofloxacin is a quinolone class antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, etc.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea

Medical Text_eng: After oral administration, ciprofloxacin is present in antibacterial concentrations in serum, tissues, and urine, therefore ciprofloxacin is indicated for the treatment of a wide range of infections caused by susceptible microorganisms, such as urinary tract and respiratory tract infections, gonorrhea, septicemia, etc.
Disease_eng: Urinary and respiratory tract infections, gonorrhea, septicemia

Medical Text_eng: Ciprofloxacin is available in the form of tablets, capsules, injections and oral suspensions. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Generally, adults are prescribed 250 to 750 mg tablets every 12 hours.
Take Ciprofloxacin as directed by a registered physician.
Ciprofloxacin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic.

Some common side effects of ciprofloxacin are nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, digestive disorders, abdominal pain. Central nervous system disorders such as headache, drowsiness, confusion, seizures and risk of retinal detachment. Hypersensitivity such as skin rash (rarely Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis), pruritus and possible systemic reactions.
Magnesium/aluminum antacids, sucralfate, or any medication containing calcium, iron, or zinc should not be taken with ciprofloxacin.
If you miss a dose of Ciprofloxacin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Other rare side effects of ciprofloxacin include joint pain, transient elevations in liver enzymes, bilirubin, urea, or creatinine. Risk of hypoglycemia and adverse effects on mental health. May increase the risk of tendinitis and tendon rupture.
Ciprofloxacin can be taken before or after meals, with plenty of fluids.
Store Ciprofloxacin away from light and moisture, below 30°C. Keep out of the reach of children.
Ciprofloxacin overdose can cause convulsions, hallucinations, abdominal discomfort, renal and hepatic dysfunction, as well as crystalluria, hematuria, and reversible kidney toxicity.
Disease_eng: Convulsions, hallucinations, abdominal discomfort, renal and hepatic dysfunction, crystalluria, hematuria and reversible renal toxicity

Medical Text_eng: Ciprofloxacin is a quinolone antibiotic that interferes with the DNA replication process of bacteria, preventing them from growing and multiplying. It is used to treat urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, prostatitis, and other bacterial infections.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, gonorrhea, prostatitis

Medical Text_eng: Isoniazid is an antitubercular medication used to treat tuberculosis (TB).
Isoniazid is an antibacterial drug that kills the organisms that cause tuberculosis.
The dosage and method of administration of isoniazid depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.

Tell your doctor if you have diabetes, a history of alcohol or other substance abuse, kidney problems, nerve problems, an unhealthy injectable drug habit, a history of HIV, or are over 35 years old, have recently given birth, or have previously taken isoniazid.
Disease_eng: Diabetes, kidney problems, nerve problems, HIV

Medical Text_eng: Some common side effects of isoniazid are nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, stomach pain, liver problems, and peripheral neuropathy (tingling in the hands and feet).
Isoniazid should be taken 1 or 2 hours before meals.
Isoniazid 300 mg tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy.
If you miss a dose of isoniazid, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Store isoniazid in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.

Isoniazid is an antitubercular drug used to treat tuberculosis (TB). It works by preventing the growth of Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria. It is usually given in combination with other antituberculosis drugs because it can lead to resistance when used alone.

Linezolid is an oxazolidinone antibiotic used to treat various infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria, such as pneumonia, skin and skin structure infections, and vancomycin-resistant enterococcus (VRE) infections.
Disease_eng: Pneumonia, skin and skin structure infections, vancomycin-resistant enterococcus infections

Medical Text_eng: Linezolid is available in tablet, injection and oral suspension forms. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Generally, adults are prescribed 600 mg tablets every 12 hours.
Linezolid tablets should be taken orally with or without food.

Some common side effects of linezolid are diarrhea, headache, and nausea. Other side effects may include oral moniliasis, vaginal moniliasis, hypertension, indigestion, localized abdominal pain, pruritus, or tongue discoloration.
Disease_eng: Diarrhea, headache, oral moniliasis, vaginal moniliasis, high blood pressure, indigestion, localized abdominal pain, pruritus or discoloration of the tongue

Medical Text_eng: Take linezolid as prescribed by a registered physician.
If you miss a dose of linezolid, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

There are no known cases of overdose with linezolid. Symptomatic and supportive care may be provided along with glomerular filtration. Approximately 30% of the linezolid dose can be removed from the body by hemodialysis in 3 hours.
Linezolid should be stored at room temperature (15°C-30°C), away from light and moisture. All medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.

Linezolid is an oxazolidinone antibiotic used to treat a variety of infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. It is mainly used in severe infections where other antibiotics are not effective.
Disease_eng: Pneumonia, skin and skin structure infections, vancomycin-resistant enterococcus infections

Medical Text_eng: Metronidazole is an antibiotic and antiprotozoal medication used to treat infections caused by bacteria and parasites.

Metronidazole is an imidazole antibacterial drug and is used in medicine as an antiprotozoan. The 5-nitro group of metronidazole is degraded by anaerobic bacteria, and experiments show that this degraded metronidazole acts on the DNA of anaerobic bacteria, giving it bactericidal activity.
Some common side effects of metronidazole are nausea, vomiting, drowsiness, diarrhea, stomach pain, headache, and metallic taste.
There have been reports that psychotic reactions may occur when metronidazole and disulfiram are used together.
Metronidazole Take the medicine as prescribed by a registered doctor.
If you miss a dose of metronidazole, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

Patients should be advised to avoid drinking alcoholic beverages during and for at least 1 day after treatment with metronidazole, as it may cause a disulfiram reaction (Antabuse effect - excessive blood supply to the skin, vomiting, rapid heartbeat).
Caution should be exercised when using metronidazole in breastfeeding mothers.
Overdose of metronidazole can cause serious side effects such as blurred vision, fainting, vomiting, ataxia, mild confusion or hallucinations, etc.
There is no antidote for metronidazole poisoning. In case of overdose, symptomatic and supportive treatment should be given.

If for any reason metronidazole treatment is required for longer than the prescribed period, the patient's blood tests, especially the white blood cell count, should be performed regularly and the patient should be monitored for adverse reactions, such as peripheral and central neuropathy (paresthesia, ataxia, tremor, convulsions).
Metronidazole may increase the level of lithium in the blood plasma.
Patients should be warned that metronidazole may darken urine.
Store below 30°C. Keep away from light. Keep out of reach of children. Do not use after expiration date.

Metronidazole is an antibiotic and antiprotozoal medication used to treat trichomoniasis, bacterial vaginosis, dysentery, and giardiasis. It also helps control gut bacteria, which play an important role in the digestive process, in some cases.
Pyrazinamide is an antitubercular medication used to treat tuberculosis (TB).

Pyrazinamide is available in tablet form. It is usually given in combination with other anti-tuberculosis drugs. The dosage and route of administration depend on the patient's age, weight, and severity of the disease.
Some common side effects of pyrazinamide are nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, stomach pain, joint pain, and liver problems.
Inform your doctor immediately if you notice any unwanted effects such as fever, abdominal tenderness, jaundice, nausea, vomiting, or loss of appetite after taking pyrazinamide.
If you miss a dose of pyrazinamide, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take the next dose at the regular time.
Taking too much pyrazinamide can cause serious side effects such as liver damage, gout, and high blood sugar levels.
Store pyrazinamide in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.
You must take pyrazinamide after meals.
Pyrazinamide works by reducing the pH/pH inside the cell and inhibiting the growth of bacteria by converting it into an active metabolite called pyrazinoic acid in the presence of this drug.

Pyrazinamide is an antitubercular drug used to treat tuberculosis (TB). It works by inhibiting the growth of Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria. It is usually given in combination with other antituberculosis drugs because it can lead to resistance when used alone.
Pyrazinamide is an anti-tuberculosis drug, which is used along with other drugs to treat tuberculosis. This drug prevents the spread of the infection.
Clarithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as pneumonia, bronchitis, skin infections, ear infections, etc.
Disease_eng: Pneumonia, bronchitis, skin infections, ear infections

Medical Text_eng: Clarithromycin is available in the form of tablets, capsules, and liquid suspension. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Typically, adults are prescribed 250 to 500 mg tablets every 12 hours.
It is also contraindicated in patients with a history of cholestatic jaundice or liver dysfunction due to clarithromycin use.
Some common side effects of clarithromycin are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, headache.
Clarithromycin can be taken both before and after meals.
Breastfeeding should be avoided during treatment with clarithromycin.
If you miss a dose of clarithromycin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Clarithromycin is contraindicated in people with hypersensitivity to clarithromycin, erythromycin, macrolide antibacterial drugs, or any other ingredient of this medication.
Most gram-negative bacteria are resistant to clarithromycin due to cross-targeting.
Clarithromycin side effects include stomatitis and glossitis. Headache and allergic reactions may also occur.
Clarithromycin is excreted primarily by the kidneys and liver. If renal function is normal, no dosage adjustment of clarithromycin is necessary for hepatic impairment alone.
Store clarithromycin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.
Clarithromycin is twice as effective as erythromycin against Haemophilus influenzae.

Clarithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It is stomach acid-tolerant and can be taken with or without food. It may help control some stomach bacteria, which play an important role in the digestive process.
Mebendazole is indicated for the treatment of threadworms, tapeworms, roundworms, and hookworms.
Mebendazole is contraindicated in patients with hypersensitivity to mebendazole or any of the ingredients of this formulation.
Mebendazole is an anthelmintic medication used to treat various types of worm infections, such as pinworms, roundworms, whipworms, and hookworms.
Mebendazole is not indicated in pregnant women.

Mebendazole is available in tablet and chewable tablet form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Generally, a single dose of one 100 mg tablet is prescribed for adults.
The relative benefits/risks should be considered when treating children under two years of age.
If you miss a dose of Mebendazole, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.

After oral administration, about 2-10% of the drug is absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract and reaches peak plasma concentrations within 30 minutes to 7 hours. Mebendazole is highly bound to plasma proteins. Its half-life ranges from 2.8 to 9 hours.
Taking too much mebendazole can cause side effects such as temporary stomach pain and diarrhea.
Store mebendazole away from light and moisture, below 25°C. Keep out of the reach of children.
Mebendazole is a synthetic broad-spectrum anthelmintic, active against most nematodes and some other worms.

Mebendazole is an anthelmintic drug used to treat a variety of worm infections. It works by disrupting the worms' glucose uptake and preventing them from producing energy. It is particularly effective against intestinal worms.
In the event of an accidental overdose of mebendazole, gastrointestinal symptoms may persist for several hours. In this case, the drug can be eliminated by vomiting.
Mebendazole is primarily used to treat intestinal nematode infections. Mebendazole inhibits the formation of microtubules in worms and reduces the worms' glucose levels.
Cefadrin is a first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as urinary tract infections, skin infections, respiratory infections, etc.
Disease_eng: Urinary tract infections, skin infections, respiratory infections

Medical Text_eng: Cefadrine is available in capsule and liquid suspension form. The dosage and method of administration depend on the type and severity of the infection. Generally, adults are prescribed 250 to 500 mg capsules every 6 hours.
Some common side effects of Cefadrin are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, headache, and skin rash.
If you miss a dose of Cefadrin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time.
Taking an overdose of Cefadrine can cause serious side effects such as blurred vision, fainting, fever, swelling of the lips, tongue, or throat, etc.
Store Cefadrin in a cool, dry place, away from light and moisture.
